algorithm_technique: Precompute min/max y for each x and min/max x for each y using hash maps. Calculate max area for horizontal/vertical sides.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest triangle area formed by three points, where at least one side is horizontal or vertical.
problem_summary_technical: Uses hash maps to store min/max y for each x and min/max x for each y. Calculates max area for axis-parallel sides.
key_insights: The problem constraints (axis-parallel sides) simplify the area calculation.
Hash maps are efficient for grouping points by x or y coordinates.
The maximum area will be formed by points that maximize the base and height for axis-parallel sides.
